Module com.example.dmscoursework
Package com.example.dmscoursework.View.Paddle

Class Paddle

java.lang.Object
com.example.dmscoursework.View.Paddle.Paddle
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicPaddle, BluePaddle, OrangePaddle, PinkPaddle
public abstract class Paddle extends Object
The Paddle class is an abstract class which contains all the relevant information that a paddle may need such as movementAmount, shape, location and methods which will make changes to these parameters.
Since:
04-01-2022
Version:
1.0
Author:
William Michiel Simson van Dijkhuizen

  • Constructor Details

    • Paddle

      public Paddle(javafx.geometry.Point2D startPosition, int width, int height, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle container)
      Constructs a paddle which has a position as a Point argument, and has width and height as an integer argument. It also specifies the container in which the paddle can move inside with the Rectangle argument.
      Parameters:
      startPosition - a Point, which is the starting position.
      width - an integer, which is the width of the paddle.
      height - an integer, which is the height of the paddle.
      container - a Rectangle, specifies limits the paddle can move.

  • Method Details

    • GetM_PaddleShape

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle GetM_PaddleShape()
      Gets the rectangle of the paddle.
      Returns:
      a Rectangle, which is the shape of the paddle.

    • GetM_StartPosition

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D GetM_StartPosition()
      Gets the coordinate of the ball.
      Returns:
      a Point2D, which is a coordinate.

    • GetM_Min

      public int GetM_Min()
      Gets the minimum x point where the paddle can collide with container.
      Returns:
      an integer, which is minimum x coordinate.

    • GetM_Max

      public int GetM_Max()
      Gets the maximum x point where the paddle can collide with container.
      Returns:
      an integer, which is maximum x coordinate.

    • Impact

      public boolean Impact(Ball ball)
      Checks if the ball has impacted the paddle.
      Parameters:
      ball - a Ball
      Returns:
      a boolean, to check if ball impacted or not.

    • Move

      public void Move()
      Logic for moving the paddle and making sure it is in the bounds of the container.

      Sets the movement amount to a negative number.

    • Stop

      public void Stop()
      Sets the movement amount to zero which stops paddle from moving.

      Moves the paddle to a specific location.
      Parameters:
